com.stormpath.sdk.provider.saml

Interface SamlProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Auditable, Provider, Resource

    public interface SamlProvider
extends Provider
    A Provider Resource that represents a SAML Identity Provider (IdP). Accounts authenticated at the IdP will automatically be synchronized to the associated Stormpath Directory.
    Since:
    1.0.RC8

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AttributeStatementMappingRules getAttributeStatementMappingRules()
      Returns the rules for mapping SAML Assertion Attributes to Stormpath Account attributes for Accounts created in the associated Stormpath Directory.
      String getEncodedX509SigningCert()
      Returns the PEM-formatted X.509 certificate used validate the SAML Identity Provider's signed SAML assertions.
      String getRequestSignatureAlgorithm()
      Returns the algorithm used by the SAML Identity provider to sign SAML assertions.
      SamlServiceProviderMetadata getServiceProviderMetadata()
      Returns the (read-only) Service Provider metadata that can be used to register and/or configure an application with a SAML Identity Provider.

    • Method Detail

      • getSsoLoginUrl

        String getSsoLoginUrl()
        Returns the URL at the SAML Identity Provider where end-users should be redirected to login. This is often called an “SSO URL”, “Login URL” or “Sign-in URL”.for the Identity Provider (IdP) SSO Login Endpoint.
        Returns:
        the URL at the SAML Identity Provider where end-users should be redirected to login.

      • setSsoLoginUrl

        void setSsoLoginUrl(String ssoLoginUrl)
        Sets the URL at the SAML Identity Provider where end-users should be redirected to login. This is often called an “SSO URL”, “Login URL” or “Sign-in URL”.for the Identity Provider (IdP) SSO Login Endpoint.

      • getSsoLogoutUrl

        String getSsoLogoutUrl()
        Returns the URL at the SAML Idenity Provider where end-users should be redirected to logout of all applications. This is often called a “Logout URL”, “Global Logout URL” or “Single Logout URL”.
        Returns:
        the URL at the SAML Idenity Provider where end-users should be redirected to logout of all applications.

      • setSsoLogoutUrl

        void setSsoLogoutUrl(String ssoLogoutUrl)
        Sets the URL at the SAML Idenity Provider where end-users should be redirected to logout of all applications. This is often called a “Logout URL”, “Global Logout URL” or “Single Logout URL”.

      • getRequestSignatureAlgorithm

        String getRequestSignatureAlgorithm()
        Returns the algorithm used by the SAML Identity provider to sign SAML assertions. If signatures are used, this value is usually either RSA-SHA1 or RSA-SHA256.
        Returns:
        the algorithm used by the SAML Identity provider to sign SAML assertions.

      • setRequestSignatureAlgorithm

        void setRequestSignatureAlgorithm(String requestSignatureAlgorithm)
        Sets the algorithm used by the SAML Identity provider to sign SAML assertions. If signatures are used, this value is usually either RSA-SHA1 or RSA-SHA256.

      • getEncodedX509SigningCert

        String getEncodedX509SigningCert()
        Returns the PEM-formatted X.509 certificate used validate the SAML Identity Provider's signed SAML assertions.
        Returns:
        the PEM-formatted X.509 certificate used validate the SAML Identity Provider's signed SAML assertions.

      • setEncodedX509SigningCert

        void setEncodedX509SigningCert(String encodedX509SigningCert)
        Sets the PEM-formatted X.509 certificate used validate the SAML Identity Provider's signed SAML assertions. This MUST be a valid PEM formatting, otherwise the value will be rejected.

      • getAttributeStatementMappingRules

        AttributeStatementMappingRules getAttributeStatementMappingRules()
        Returns the rules for mapping SAML Assertion Attributes to Stormpath Account attributes for Accounts created in the associated Stormpath Directory.
        Returns:
        the rules for mapping SAML Assertion Attributes to Stormpath Account attributes for Accounts created in the associated Stormpath Directory.

      • setAttributeStatementMappingRules

        void setAttributeStatementMappingRules(AttributeStatementMappingRules attributeStatementMappingRules)
        Sets the rules for mapping SAML Assertion Attributes to Stormpath Account attributes for Accounts created in the associated Stormpath Directory.

      • getServiceProviderMetadata

        SamlServiceProviderMetadata getServiceProviderMetadata()
        Returns the (read-only) Service Provider metadata that can be used to register and/or configure an application with a SAML Identity Provider.

        This metadata is almost always accessed as an XML document and provided to the SAML Identity Provider when registering with the Identity Provider, and not often accessed in Java code or as JSON. It is provided as a type-safe resource however should you wish to read the associated values.

        The returned object is read-only. Because Stormpath fully automates SAML assertion exchange between the Identity Provider, there is nothing to configure, so there are no mutator (setter) methods necessary.

        Returns:
        the (read-only) Service Provider metadata that can be used to register and/or configure an application with a SAML Identity Provider.
